item.title: Probing supersolidity through excitations in a spin-orbit–coupled Bose-Einstein condensate
item.author: C. S. Chisholm
item.content:encoded:
Spin-orbit–coupled Bose-Einstein condensates are a flexible experimental platform to engineer synthetic quantum many-body systems. In particular, they host the so-called stripe phase, an instance of a supersolid state of matter. The peculiar excitation ...

item.title: Observation of the Einstein–de Haas effect in a Bose–Einstein condensate
item.author: Hiroki Matsui
item.content:encoded:
The Einstein–de Haas effect is a phenomenon in which angular momentum is transferred from microscopic spins to mechanical rotation of a macroscopic rigid body. We report an observation of the Einstein–de Haas effect in a spinor-dipolar Bose–Einstein ...
